quizDescription: Put your thinking cap on and solve these mind-bending riddles.

questions.question: What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
questions.explanation: The letter 'M' appears once in the word 'minute,' twice in the word 'moment,' but not at all in 'a thousand years.'

questions.question: I'm tall when I'm young and short when I'm old. What am I?
questions.explanation: A candle is tall when it's newly lit (young) and becomes shorter as it burns (old).

questions.question: I'm found in socks, scarves, and mittens, but never in a river. What am I?
questions.explanation: The letter 'R' is found in 'socks,' 'scarves,' and 'mittens' but not in the word 'river.'

questions.question: I have keys but can't open locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but you can't go inside. What am I?
questions.explanation: A keyboard has keys (letters/characters) but doesn't open locks. It has space between keys but no physical room you can enter.

questions.question: I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
questions.explanation: A joke can be 'cracked' (told), 'made' (created), 'told' (shared), and 'played' (used for humor).

questions.question: I'm not alive, but I can die. What am I?
questions.explanation: A battery provides power, but it can 'die' when it runs out of energy. It is not a living thing.

questions.question: What has keys but can't open locks?
questions.explanation: A keyboard has keys (letters/characters) but doesn't open locks. It's used for typing and input.

questions.question: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
questions.explanation: The more footsteps you take, the more footprints or marks you leave behind.

questions.question: I'm an odd number. Take away a letter, and I become even. What am I?
questions.explanation: Seven is an odd number. When you take away the 's,' it becomes 'even.'

questions.question: I have keys but can't open locks. I have a space but no room. You can enter, but you can't go inside. What am I?
questions.explanation: A computer keyboard has keys (letters/characters) but doesn't open locks. It has space between keys but no physical room you can enter.
